718021f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Greene Street
718021f-a.text:
317 to 331 Canal Street, north side, east of, adjoining, and at
the east corner of Qreene Street, which begins here.
1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718895f-a.title: Manhattan: Church Street - Canal Street
718895f-a.text:
Church Street, west side, south from, Canal (forecround),
to Walker Streets, showino; a vacant lot between Ganal and
Lisperard and the New York Telephone Building betweer the latter
point and Walker Street. Upon the cleared sxce will rise
a nex Post Office station. The photographer is vieving south-
westward from s vantage point at Canal and Greene Streets.
Juuly 4, 1938.
V.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718895f-a.folder: Church Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718035f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Church Street
718035f-a.text:
Canal Street, south side, west from Church Street, to
West Broadvay (8th Avenue ''E1'' thereon). No. 1 is soth-
westward from Uannal ard GGreene SStreets and shows the easterly
portion of this block and upon vhich in November 1938 will
rise a new ~.0. Station. This is the present west side of
Church Street, from Canal to Lispnard Streets after widening.
Soth of the latter poirt is the New York Telenhone Building.
V9ew No. 2 is southNard down Wooster Street and shows No's.
EN(8 to 3A8. These are included in the demolition for the afoSe.
entioner P.O. site.
V1ew To.3 is extensive and shovs the entire block front
exclusive of the corner structure at Church 5treet (left).
Juue 23, 1933.
Views 1,2 and 3
P.L. Sperr
